#Text=Bagrationi , wife of John IV of Trebizond
#Text=Bagrationi ( c. 1411/2 – before 1438 ) was the first Empress consort of John IV of Trebizond .
#Text=Her name is unknown .
#Text=Family
#Text=She was a daughter of King Alexander I of Georgia and his first wife Dulandukht , the daughter of Beshken II Orbeliani . [ 1 ]
#Text=Dulandukht had died or was repudiated before 1415 , when Alexander married his second wife , the heiress of Imereti , daughter of Alexander I of Imereti . [ 2 ]
#Text=Empress
#Text=In about 1426 , she married John IV of Trebizond , the son of Emperor Alexios IV of Trebizond and Theodora Kantakouzene , who had fled from Trebizond after a violent episode . [ 3 ]

#Text=According to a passage considered to be an interpolation in the history of Laonikos Chalkokondyles , he had accused his mother Theodora of having an affair with an unnamed protovestarios , whom he killed , then held his parents captive in the citadel until the palace staff released them . [ 4 ]
#Text=Sometime after marrying Bagrationi , John left Georgia for Caffa , where he sought to charter a large galley and its crew .
#Text=By 1429 he had found one , for in that year he returned to Trebizond .
#Text=Alexios IV prepared to face his son in the battlefield .
#Text=John suborned some of his father 's retainers , who assassinated Alexios IV while he slept .
#Text=He executed the assassins of his father in order to deny any connection with them , then succeeded his father , presumably with Bagrationi as his Empress . [ 5 ]
#Text=Their daughter Theodora Komnene was betrothed to Uzun Hassan of Ak Koyunlu in 1457 , whom she married the next year .
#Text=According to Anthony Bryer , this is the " most celebrated Trapezuntine-Muslim marriage " , and for which the terms of their marriage can be determined .

#Text=These terms included : a dowry of properties in the villages of Halanik and Sesera ; a " bride-price " in that Uzun Hassan would extend some kind of effort to help defend Trebizond ; Theodora 's right to continue to profess the Christian faith , keep a chaplain , and act as protector of Christians subject to Uzun Hassan ; and " as it turned out , Theodora 's considerable ( and probably unusual ) right to influence Akkoyunlu foreign relations
